definition: Aum Shinrikyo (or Supreme Truth), the Japanese death cult responsible for the 1995 sarin gas attack on the Tokyo subway
Austria/Austrian/abbr. for 奧地利|奥地利[Ao4 di4 li4]/Olympic/Olympics/abbr. for 奧林匹克|奥林匹克[Ao4 lin2 pi3 ke4]
woman who looks after small children/(old) female tutor
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: The group has asked for a stay of execution for all the Aum cultists.
sentences.chinese: 该教团已申请对所有奥姆真理教信徒执行缓刑。

sentences.english: Aum Shinrikyo reinvented itself as the Aleph group, which continues to operate as a spiritual group.
sentences.chinese: 奥姆真理教改名为阿莱夫教，并仍然以教团身份运作。

sentences.english: Thus, the Aum Shinrikyo 189 trial of the accused came to an end.
sentences.chinese: 至此，奥姆真理教189名被告的审判宣告结束。

definition: Tojo Hideki (1884-1948), Japanese military leader hanged as war criminal in 1948
Yasukuni Shrine, Shinto shrine in Tokyo to Japanese war dead, controversial as burial ground of several Class A war criminals
Ishihara Jintarō (1932-), Japanese author and politician, governor of Tokyo since 1999
